result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramia M Windom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 07/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 10 days jail for non-payment.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 15CM1102 and 14CT0795 were dismissed and read in.

  Expunction is conditionally granted after 1 year and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees (including payment of all Attorndy fees) and no new criminal law violations.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Ponath.
From Shorehaven regarding counseling

Defendant Tramia M Windom in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ponath makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

FINE:  $515.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($100.00) and remainder due at $50.00 per month, commencing 7/1/16, alternate 12 days jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

***Expunction is conditionally granted after 1 year and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees (to include payment of attorney's fees) and no new criminal law violations.***

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tramia M Windom in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she did not qualify for public defender representation and requests a court appointed attorney.  Court reviews petition and grants Defendant's request for a court appointed attorney.  Court orders Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 11/2/15 and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with the charged co-defendant or JCPenny listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Tramia M Windom in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a non collect call. 
  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.
